speaker: Doctor
text: What specific symptoms are you experiencing with your gait and limb ataxia? Are there any other neurological symptoms, such as weakness or numbness?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been having a lot of trouble walking, and my friends say I look like I'm drunk. My limbs feel uncoordinated, and I've noticed reduced strength in my right arm. No numbness, but it feels really awkward to move.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent changes in your vision, such as double vision or blurred vision?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any changes in my vision. It's mainly just the difficulty with my walking and the awkwardness in my limbs.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections, illnesses, or injuries that could have contributed to these symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent infections or injuries that I can think of. I've just been dealing with my ongoing issues related to my condition.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your speech or difficulty swallowing?

speaker: Patient
text: No changes in my speech or difficulty swallowing. It's really just the issues with my walking and the coordination in my limbs that are concerning me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any tremors or involuntary movements in your limbs?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any tremors or involuntary movements. It's mostly just the unsteadiness and awkwardness when I try to move.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any history of alcohol or substance use that could be affecting your coordination?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have a history of alcohol or substance use. I've always been careful about that, so I don't think it's related to anything like that.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your mood or cognitive function, such as memory problems or difficulty concentrating?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant changes in my mood or memory. I feel a bit frustrated with my mobility issues, but my concentration seems to be okay.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of neurological disorders or genetic conditions that could be relevant to your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't know of any family history of neurological disorders or genetic conditions. My family has generally been healthy, so I'm not sure if that would be a factor.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests or imaging studies done? If so, what were the results?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent blood tests or imaging studies done. The last tests were a while ago, and I haven't followed up on them since my symptoms worsened.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your coordination or balance when performing fine motor tasks, such as buttoning a shirt or writing?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've definitely noticed that my coordination is off when I try to do fine motor tasks. Buttoning my shirt or writing has become more challenging, and I often fumble or drop things. It feels like my fingers aren't responding as they should.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of dizziness or lightheadedness, especially when standing up quickly?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any dizziness or lightheadedness when standing up. It's mainly just the issues with my walking and coordination that are bothering me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your reflexes, such as being more or less responsive than usual?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really paid much attention to my reflexes, but I don't feel like they're different. It's mostly just the walking and coordination issues that are on my mind.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual fatigue or weakness in your legs, especially after physical activity?

speaker: Patient
text: I've definitely felt more fatigued than usual, especially after trying to walk or do any physical activity. My legs feel weaker, and it takes a lot of effort to move them.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite that might be relevant to your symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant changes in my weight or appetite recently. I'm still eating, but I feel like my energy levels are lower than usual.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever been diagnosed with any autoimmune conditions or neurological disorders in the past?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been diagnosed with any autoimmune conditions or neurological disorders before. My main health issue has been Crohn disease, which I've been managing for the past couple of years.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any gastrointestinal symptoms recently, such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, or changes in your bowel habits related to your Crohn's disease?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any significant gastrointestinal symptoms lately. My main concerns are really focused on the difficulty walking and the coordination issues with my limbs.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your skin, such as rashes or discoloration, that could be related to your Crohn's disease or other conditions?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any changes in my skin, like rashes or discoloration. My focus has really been on the mobility issues and how awkward my limbs feel when I try to move.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of numbness or tingling in your extremities, particularly in your hands or feet?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any numbness or tingling in my hands or feet. It's really just the difficulty with walking and the awkwardness in my limbs that I'm dealing with.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you ever had any neurological evaluations or tests done in the past, such as an MRI or lumbar puncture, to assess for any underlying conditions?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any neurological evaluations or tests like an MRI or lumbar puncture before. This is the first time I'm experiencing these kinds of symptoms, so I haven't felt the need for those tests until now.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on your symptoms of gait and limb ataxia, along with your history of Crohn's disease, I suspect there may be an underlying neurological issue. I would like to request an MRI of your brain and spinal cord to look for any abnormalities. REQUEST TEST: MRI_Brain_and_Spinal_Cord

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: MRI Brain findings show lesions consistent with Progressive Multifocal Encephalopathy (PML). T1/T2 images reveal multifocal demyelinating lesions without gadolinium enhancement, indicative of PML.
